description-of-file: This file is just a generic basic siddur viz. one size fits all.

sections.description: It is customary to recite these blessings upon waking and preparing for the day. Some are said at home, others in the synagogue.

prayers.title: Modei Ani (I Give Thanks)
prayers.instructions: Upon awakening, while still in bed:
prayers.hebrew: מוֹדֶה אֲנִי לְפָנֶֽיךָ מֶֽלֶךְ חַי וְקַיָּם. שֶׁהֶֽחֱזַֽרְתָּ בִּי נִשְׁמָתִי בְחֶמְלָה. רַבָּה אֱמֽוּנָתֶֽךָ׃
prayers.english: I offer thanks before You, living and eternal King, for You have mercifully restored my soul within me; Your faithfulness is great.

prayers.title: Netilat Yadayim (Washing of Hands)
prayers.instructions: After washing hands (Netilat Yadayim), recite the following blessing:
prayers.hebrew: בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה יְיָ אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ מֶֽלֶךְ הָעוֹלָם, אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָֽׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו, וְצִוָּֽנוּ עַל נְטִילַת יָדָֽיִם׃
prayers.english: Blessed are You, ETERNAL our God, King of the universe, Who has sanctified us with His commandments, and commanded us concerning the washing of hands.

prayers.title: Asher Yatzar (Who Formed)
prayers.hebrew: בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה יְיָ אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ מֶֽלֶךְ הָעוֹלָם, אֲשֶׁר יָצַר אֶת הָאָדָם בְּחָכְמָה, וּבָֽרָא בוֹ נְקָבִים נְקָבִים, חֲלוּלִים חֲלוּלִים. גָּלוּי וְיָדֽוּעַ לִפְנֵי כִסֵּא כְבוֹדֶֽךָ, שֶׁאִם יִפָּתֵֽחַ אֶחָד מֵהֶם, אוֹ יִסָּתֵם אֶחָד מֵהֶם, אִי אֶפְשַׁר לְהִתְקַיֵּם וְלַעֲמֹד לְפָנֶֽיךָ אֲפִילוּ שָׁעָה אֶחָת. בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה יְיָ, רוֹפֵא כָל בָּשָׂר וּמַפְלִיא לַעֲשׂוֹת׃
prayers.english: Blessed are You, ETERNAL our God, King of the universe, Who formed man with wisdom and created in him many openings and many cavities. It is obvious and known before Your Throne of Glory that if but one of them were to be ruptured or if but one of them were to be blocked, it would be impossible to survive and to stand before You even for one hour. Blessed are You, ETERNAL, Who heals all flesh and acts wondrously.

prayers.title: Elohai Neshamah (My G-d, the Soul)
prayers.hebrew: אֱלֹהַי, נְשָׁמָה שֶׁנָּתַֽתָּ בִּי טְהוֹרָה הִיא. אַתָּה בְרָאתָהּ, אַתָּה יְצַרְתָּהּ, אַתָּה נְפַחְתָּהּ בִּי, וְאַתָּה מְשַׁמְּרָהּ בְּקִרְבִּי, וְאַתָּה עָתִיד לִטְּלָהּ מִמֶּֽנִּי, וּלְהַחֲזִירָהּ בִּי לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא. כָּל זְמַן שֶׁהַנְּשָׁמָה בְקִרְבִּי, מוֹדֶה אֲנִי לְפָנֶֽיךָ יְיָ אֱלֹהַי וֵאלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתַי, רִבּוֹן כָּל הַמַּעֲשִׂים, אֲדוֹן כָּל הַנְּשָׁמוֹת. בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה יְיָ, הַמַּחֲזִיר נְשָׁמוֹת לִפְגָרִים מֵתִים׃
prayers.english: My God, the soul You placed within me is pure. You created it, You formed it, You breathed it into me, and You preserve it within me. You will eventually take it from me, and restore it to me in the time to come. As long as the soul is within me, I give thanks to You, ETERNAL my God and God of my ancestors, Master of all works, Lord of all souls. Blessed are You, ETERNAL, Who restores souls to dead bodies.

prayers.title: Yehi Ratzon (May it be Your will)
prayers.hebrew: וִיהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶֽיךָ יְיָ אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ וֵאלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתֵֽינוּ, שֶׁתַּרְגִּילֵֽנוּ בְּתוֹרָתֶֽךָ, וְדַבְּקֵֽנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתֶֽיךָ, וְאַל תְּבִיאֵֽנוּ לֹא לִידֵי חֵטְא, וְלֹא לִידֵי עֲבֵרָה וְעָוֹן, וְלֹא לִידֵי נִסָּיוֹן, וְלֹא לִידֵי בִזָּיוֹן, וְאַל תַּשְׁלֶט בָּֽנוּ יֵֽצֶר הָרָע, וְהַרְחִיקֵֽנוּ מֵאָדָם רָע וּמֵחָבֵר רָע, וְדַבְּקֵֽנוּ בְּיֵֽצֶר הַטּוֹב וּבְמַעֲשִׂים טוֹבִים, וְכֹף אֶת יִצְרֵֽנוּ לְהִשְׁתַּעְבֶּד לָךְ, וּתְנֵֽנוּ הַיּוֹם וּבְכָל יוֹם לְחֵן וּלְחֶֽסֶד וּלְרַחֲמִים בְּעֵינֶֽיךָ וּבְעֵינֵי כָל רוֹאֵֽינוּ, וְתִגְמְlֵֽנוּ חֲסָדִים טוֹבִים. בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה יְיָ, גּוֹמֵל חֲסָדִים טוֹבִים לְעַמּוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל׃
prayers.english: May it be Your will, ETERNAL our God and God of our ancestors, that You accustom us to Your Torah and attach us to Your commandments. Do not bring us to sin, nor to transgression or iniquity, nor to trial, nor to disgrace. Do not let the evil inclination rule over us. Keep us far from a bad person and a bad friend. Attach us to the good inclination and to good deeds. Compel our inclination to be subservient to You. Grant us today and every day grace, kindness, and mercy in Your eyes and in the eyes of all who see us, and bestow upon us good kindnesses. Blessed are You, ETERNAL, Who bestows good kindnesses upon His people Israel.

parts.hebrew: בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה יְיָ אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ מֶֽלֶךְ הָעוֹלָם, אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָֽׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו וְצִוָּֽנוּ עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה׃
parts.english: Blessed are You, ETERNAL our God, King of the universe, Who has sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us concerning the words of Torah.

parts.hebrew: וְהַעֲרֶב נָא יְיָ אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ אֶת דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָתְךָ בְּפִֽינוּ וּבְפִיפִיּוֹת עַמְּךָ בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְנִהְיֶה אֲנַֽחְנוּ וְצֶאֱצָאֵֽינוּ וְצֶאֱצָאֵי צֶאֱצָאֵֽינוּ, וְצֶאֱצָאֵי עַמְּךָ בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל, כֻּלָּֽנוּ יוֹדְעֵי שְׁמֶֽךָ וְלוֹמְדֵי תוֹרָתֶֽךָ לִשְׁמָהּ. בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה יְיָ, הַמְלַמֵּד תּוֹרָה לְעַמּוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל׃
parts.english: And please, ETERNAL our God, make the words of Your Torah sweet in our mouths and in the mouths of Your people, the House of Israel. May we, our offspring, and the offspring of our offspring, and the offspring of Your people, the House of Israel, all know Your Name and study Your Torah for its own sake. Blessed are You, ETERNAL, Who teaches Torah to His people Israel.

parts.hebrew: בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה יְיָ אֱלֹהֵינוּ מֶֽלֶךְ הָעוֹלָם, אֲשֶׁר בָּחַר בָּֽנוּ מִכָּל הָעַמִּים וְנָֽתַן לָֽנוּ אֶת תּוֹרָתוֹ. בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה יְיָ, נוֹתֵן הַתּוֹרָה׃
parts.english: Blessed are You, ETERNAL our God, King of the universe, Who has chosen us from all peoples and given us His Torah. Blessed are You, ETERNAL, Giver of the Torah.

parts.hebrew: יְבָרֶכְךָ֥ יְיָ וְיִשְׁמְרֶֽךָ׃ יָאֵ֨ר יְיָ פָּנָיו֙ אֵלֶ֣יךָ וִֽיחֻנֶּֽךָּ׃ יִשָּׂ֨א יְיָ פָּנָיו֙ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְיָשֵׂ֥ם לְךָ֖ שָׁלֽוֹם׃
parts.english: May Hashem bless you and safeguard you. May Hashem illuminate His countenance for you and be gracious to you. May Hashem turn His countenance to you and establish peace for you.

parts.hebrew: אֵלּוּ דְבָרִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם שִׁעוּר: הַפֵּאָה, וְהַבִּכּוּרִים, וְהָרְאָיוֹן, וּגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים, וְתַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה. אֵלּוּ דְבָRִים שֶׁאָדָם אוֹכֵל פֵּרוֹתֵיהֶם בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וְהַקֶּרֶן קַיֶּמֶת לוֹ לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא: כִּבּוּד אָב וָאֵם, וּגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים, וְהַשְׁכָּמַת בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ שַׁחֲרִית וְעַרְבִית, וְהַכְנָסַת אוֹרְחִים, וּבִקּוּר חוֹלִים, וְהַכְנָסַת כַּלָּה, וּלְוָיַת הַמֵּת, וְעִיּוּן תְּפִלָּה, וַהֲבָאַת שָׁלוֹם בֵּין אָדָם לַחֲבֵרוֹ, וּבֵין אִישׁ לְאִשְׁתּוֹ. וְתַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה כְּנֶגֶד כֻּלָּם׃
parts.english: These are things that have no fixed measure: the corner of the field (Peah), first fruits (Bikkurim), the appearance-offering (during festivals), acts of loving-kindness (Gemilut Chasadim), and the study of Torah. These are things whose fruits a person enjoys in this world, while the principal remains for him for the World to Come: honoring father and mother, acts of loving-kindness, early attendance at the house of study morning and evening, hospitality to guests, visiting the sick, dowering the bride, accompanying the dead to the grave, concentration in prayer, and bringing peace between a man and his fellow, and between a husband and his wife. And the study of Torah is equivalent to them all.

shacharis.siddurNote: This Siddur is intended for weekday Shacharis services and aims to follow traditional Orthodox liturgy. Instructions for ritual actions, such as taking three steps before and after the Amidah, will be included at the appropriate liturgical points.

sections.description: A series of blessings, psalms, and verses that serve as a spiritual preparation for the core prayers.

prayers.title: Baruch She'amar (Blessed is He Who Spoke)
Tehilim(Psalms) 146-150
prayers.englishCommentary: This series of five tehilims forms the climactic core of Pesukei D'Zimra...

prayers.title: Yishtabach (May Your Name Be Praised)
prayers.english: May Your name be praised forever, our King...
prayers.englishCommentary: Yishtabach is the blessing that concludes Pesukei D'Zimra...

sections.description: Selections concerning the daily temple offerings. It is customary to recite some or all of the following.

prayers.title: Parashat HaTamid (The Daily Offering)
prayers.englishCommentary: Parashat HaTamid is the section from Numbers 28:1-8 that details the Tamid, or the 'continual offering.'...

prayers.title: Eizehu Mekoman (Where is Their Place?)
prayers.english: What is the place of sacrifices?...
prayers.englishCommentary: This passage from the Mishnah details the specific locations within the Temple where different types of sacrifices were brought.

prayers.title: Rabbi Yishmael Omer (Rabbi Yishmael Says)
prayers.hebrew: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה מִדּוֹת הַתּוֹרָה נִדְרֶשֶׁת...
prayers.english: Rabbi Yishmael says: The Torah is expounded by thirteen principles:...
prayers.englishCommentary: This text outlines the thirteen hermeneutic principles used to interpret the Torah, forming a foundational element of Talmudic logic.

prayers.title: Concluding Prayer for Korbanot
prayers.hebrew: יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ יְיָ אֱלֹהֵינוּ וֵאלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתֵינוּ, שֶׁיִּבָּנֶה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בִּמְהֵרָה בְיָמֵינוּ, וְתֵן חֶלְקֵנוּ בְּתוֹרָתֶךָ. וְשָׁם נַעֲבָדְךָ בְּיִרְאָה כִּימֵי עוֹלָם וּכְשָׁנִים קַדְמוֹנִיּוֹת.
prayers.english: May it be Your will, ETERNAL our God and God of our ancestors, that the Holy Temple be rebuilt speedily in our days, and grant us our portion in Your Torah. And there we will serve You with awe as in days of old and as in ancient years.
